On Tue, Nov 13, 2007 at 03:45:29PM +0100, Lawrence Oluyede wrote:
> Is it safe to send 404 for unavailable representations of an existing resource?
> 
> Let's suppose the resource is /foo
> 
> GET /foo
> <= 200 OK
> 
> GET /foo.xml
> <= 404 Not Found

What you're requesting here is resource "/foo.xml", not xml representation 
of resource "/foo".  I believe 404 is an appropriate response here.

> GET /foo
> Accept: application/xml
> 
> <= 404 Not Found

And in this case you should use 406, as explained by Matthias Ernst.

	Sergei
